questions.text: After oral administration, the fraction of the drug reaching the systemic circulation in unchanged is known as?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Bioavailability It is a measure of the fraction of administered dose of a drug that reaches the systemic circulation in an unchanged form for example, if we give 500mg of the drug paracetamol by oral route then if 350mg is available for systemic action, 350mg of the drug is bioavailable

Highyeild:

Bioavailability refers to the rate and extent of absorption of a drug from a dosage form administered by any route, as determined by its concentration-time curve in blood or by its excretion in urine. It is a measure of the fraction (F ) of the administered dose of a drug that reaches systemic circulation in the unchanged form. Bioavailability of drug injected i.v. is 100%, but is frequently lower after oral ingestion because— (a) the drug may be incompletely absorbed. (b) the absorbed drug may under first-pass pass metabolism in the intestinal wall/liver or be excreted in bile Incomplete bioavailability after s.c. or i.m. injection is less common but may occur due to the local binding of the drug

questions.text: Among the following options, the rate of drug absorption is indicated by:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Tmax

Highyeild:

Time to Peak (Tmax): the time after admin that it takes for the drug to reach Cmax. This is an indication of the rate of absorption. The onset of Action: The time required to reach the Minimum Effective Concentration (MEC) following drug administration Minimum Effective Concentration (MEC): minimum plasma concentration of drug required to produce a therapeutic effect. Half-life(t1/2): Time is taken by the body to reduce current Cmax by 50% (same as the time taken to achieve a 50 % increase. At 5 half live period 97% of ANY drug will be eliminated regardless of the initial concentration The time duration the drug stays in the body is the duration of action of the drug

questions.text: A 56-year-old male comes to the emergency with severe chest pain. The medical officer administered him nitroglycerine for immediate relief of anginal pain. Which of the following route was preferred to administer nitroglycerine so that it can bypass first-pass metabolism?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sublingual

Highyeild:

Sublingual route – the tablet is crushed in the mouth or placed under the tongue, absorption is rapid and action can be produced in minutes. The chief advantage is it can bypass first-pass metabolism The oral route has high first-pass metabolism Rectal route – 50% of drug absorbed into external hemorrhoidal vein bypasses the liver but is not absorbed into internal hemorrhoidal veins Intradermal is employed for specific purposes only like administering BCG vaccine and sensitivity testing

questions.text: A physician wants to start an oral antihypertensive for a patient. He is selecting the dose of a drug depending upon the first-pass metabolism of that particular drug. Which of the following is TRUE regarding first-pass metabolism?

options.label: A
options.text: Propranolol requires a higher dose to be administered due to high first-pass metabolism

options.label: B
options.text: Oral bioavailability is increased in patients with severe liver disease

options.label: C
options.text: There is marked individual variation in oral dose due to differences in the extent of first-pass metabolism

questions.explanation:
Solution:

All of the above Explanation: Propranolol, morphine, salbutamol, and verapamil requires a higher dose to be administered due to high first-pass metabolism Oral bioavailability is increased in patients with severe liver disease There is marked individual variation in oral dose due to differences in the extent of first-pass metabolism
